attributes.action: Lift the prohibition that bars disabled people from access to local training facilities
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
People who become disabled as adults often need to retrain in a different area of work but any application for basic re-training is subject to mandatory refusal (as a result of  government funding policy on education) if they: 

1. attended college 20 years before becoming disabled, or 

2. recieve only incapacity benefit, which is specifically excluded from the qualifying benefits that allow other unemployed people access to free basic level training in a wide range of subjects. 

If the Government wants disabled people to undertake training, this petitioner respectfully suggests that local collages should be allowed to  accept them onto appropriate courses.

reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
